doc.title: Ktreedist

description.text: Calculation of the minimum branch length distance (K tree score) between phylogenetic trees

doc.reference: Soria-Carrasco, V., Talavera, G., Igea, J., and Castresana, J. (2007). The K tree score: quantification of differences in the relative branch length and topology of phylogenetic trees. Bioinformatics 23, 2954-2956.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The program is supposed to run with one reference tree and one or several comparison trees. If the reference file contains more than one tree, only the first one will be used.
This is the file that contains the tree to which you want to compare the comparison tree/s.
Only NEWICK or NEXUS tree format are accepted by ktreedist.
The input tree must be write in one line. for nexus tree the tree itself must be write in one line
This is the file that contains the tree or the set of trees you want to compare to the reference tree. They will be scaled to match as much as possible the reference tree.
Only NEWICK or NEXUS tree format are accepted by ktreedist.
The input tree must be write in one line. for nexus tree the tree itself must be write in one line

xhtml:div.label:
Output file for table of results (-t)?
Yes No
A file containing a table of results is generated.

Output file for table of partitions (-p)?
Yes No
A file containing a table of partitions for each comparison tree is generated.

Output file for comparison tree/s after scaling (-s)?
Yes No
A file containing the scaled comparison tree/s is generated.

Output symmetric difference (Robinson-Foulds) (-r)?
Yes No
The symmetric difference is defined as the number of partitions that are not shared between two trees, that is, the number of partitions of the first tree that are not present in the second tree plus the number of partitions of the second tree that are not present in the first tree.

Output number of partitions in the comparison tree/s (-n)?
Yes No
The knowledge of the number of partitions may be useful to detect trees with polytomies.

Equivalent to all options (-a)?
Yes No
Equivalent to all options.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This is the file that contains the tree to which you want to compare the comparison tree/s.
Only NEWICK or NEXUS tree format are accepted by ktreedist.
The input tree must be write in one line. for nexus tree the tree itself must be write in one line
This is the file that contains the tree or the set of trees you want to compare to the reference tree. They will be scaled to match as much as possible the reference tree.
Only NEWICK or NEXUS tree format are accepted by ktreedist.
The input tree must be write in one line. for nexus tree the tree itself must be write in one line
A file containing a table of results is generated.
A file containing a table of partitions for each comparison tree is generated.
A file containing the scaled comparison tree/s is generated.

The symmetric difference is defined as the number of partitions that are not shared between two trees, that is, the number of partitions of the first tree that are not present in the second tree plus the number of partitions of the second tree that are not present in the first tree.
The knowledge of the number of partitions may be useful to detect trees with polytomies.
Equivalent to all options.
